intro: Doronicum plantagineum proles willdenowii, commonly known as the meadow anemone, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to central and eastern Europe. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal rosettes of heart-shaped leaves and showy, white to pale yellow flowers with a central yellow stigma. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and stream banks. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and its ability to spread through rhizomes, forming dense colonies. The species is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
